{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Thomson |model=SpeedTouch 780 WL |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=12/29/2005 |manuf_country= |manuf=Askey |manuf_model=RTA1006VW-D49 |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router,dsl modem,analog phone gateway |fcc_id=RSE-ST780 |ic_id= |pwr_v=18-22 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn= |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM6348 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4318 |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bg |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Broadcom |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports= |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bg |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.1.254 |default_user=Administrator |default_pass= |oui=00:90:D0 |oui_eth= |default_ch= }} [http://www.cerberusnetworks.co.uk/PDF/780wl_userguide.pdf User's guide]
The FCC ID appears to apply to multple models (which are listed below)... *SpeedTouch 780 WL **DSLBB643 EB **DSLBB843 EB **DSLBB643 EE *SpeedTouch 706 WL **DSLBB643 ED **DSLBB843 ED **DSLBB843 EF
[http://wiki.openwrt.org/doku.php?id=oldwiki:openwrtdocs:hardware:thomson:speedtouch780wl On the OpenWrt wiki]
There appears to be an Infineon (?? or not) chip on-board to handle VoIP.
The default SSID is probably '''SpeedTouchXXXXXX''', where '''XXXXXX''' is probably some combination hex digits (probably upper case letters). Administrator:''blank'' is probably the default Telnet and FTP password. HTTP web configuration may be (by default) unprotected.
